queries.name: Exact Match Query

inputs_required.column_name: Name of the column to match against

queries.output_expected: A dataset containing all rows where the column exactly matches the provided value.
queries.explanation: This query filters the dataset by verifying each row's specified column against an exact value.
queries.details: Use this query when you need to retrieve data based on an exact match; for example, filtering users by ID or name.

queries.name: LIKE Query

inputs_required.column_name: Column name to perform pattern matching
inputs_required.pattern: The pattern to search for, e.g., 'prefix%'

queries.output_expected: Rows where the column contains values matching the specified pattern.
queries.explanation: Uses the SQL LIKE operator to facilitate pattern matching on text data.
queries.details: Useful for fuzzy matching or searching for values that begin with, end with, or contain a certain substring.

queries.name: At Coordinates Query
queries.output_expected: Records that exactly match the given latitude and longitude.
queries.explanation: This query retrieves data that is precisely at the specified coordinates.
queries.details: Useful for pinpointing exact locations in geospatial datasets.

queries.name: Within Radius Query
queries.output_expected: Rows that are within the specified radius from the target coordinates.
queries.explanation: Calculates the distance from each record to the target point and filters those within the given radius.
queries.details: Assumes the presence of spatial functions like ST_Distance and ST_Point. Ideal for proximity search.

queries.name: Nearest Query
queries.code_to_execute: SELECT *, ST_Distance(ST_Point({lon_col}, {lat_col}), ST_Point({target_lon}, {target_lat})) AS distance FROM '{parquet_file}' ORDER BY distance ASC LIMIT 1;
queries.output_expected: The row that is closest to the specified coordinates along with its calculated distance.
queries.explanation: Sorts the rows by their distance from a target point and retrieves the nearest one.
queries.details: Ideal for applications requiring nearest neighbor lookup in a spatial dataset.

queries.name: Bounding Box Query
queries.code_to_execute: SELECT * FROM '{parquet_file}' WHERE {lat_col} BETWEEN {min_lat} AND {max_lat} AND {lon_col} BETWEEN {min_lon} AND {max_lon};
queries.output_expected: All records that fall within the defined rectangular area.
queries.explanation: Filters records whose latitude and longitude lie within the specified ranges.
queries.details: Useful for spatial queries that define areas with bounding coordinates.

queries.name: Count Within Radius Query
queries.code_to_execute: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM '{parquet_file}' WHERE ST_Distance(ST_Point({lon_col}, {lat_col}), ST_Point({target_lon}, {target_lat})) < {radius};

inputs_required.radius: Radius within which to count records

queries.output_expected: The number of records found within the specified radius.
queries.explanation: Counts the number of locations within a given radius using spatial distance.
queries.details: Ideal for obtaining summary statistics on spatial data.

queries.name: Aggregate Query
queries.code_to_execute: SELECT {group_column}, COUNT(*) FROM '{parquet_file}' WHERE ST_Distance(ST_Point({lon_col}, {lat_col}), ST_Point({target_lon}, {target_lat})) < {radius} GROUP BY {group_column};

inputs_required.group_column: Column name to group the results by
inputs_required.radius: Radius within which to aggregate records

queries.output_expected: Aggregated counts of records grouped by the specified column for entries within the radius.
queries.explanation: Groups spatially filtered records by a designated column and returns the count for each group.
queries.details: Useful for analyzing spatial data categorization and distribution.

queries.name: Combined Filters Query
queries.code_to_execute: SELECT * FROM '{parquet_file}' WHERE {text_column} LIKE '{pattern}' AND ST_Distance(ST_Point({lon_col}, {lat_col}), ST_Point({target_lon}, {target_lat})) < {radius};

inputs_required.text_column: Name of the column for text pattern matching
inputs_required.radius: Radius within which to apply spatial filtering

queries.output_expected: Records meeting both the text-based and spatial proximity criteria.
queries.explanation: Combines a LIKE-based text filter with a spatial filter based on proximity.
queries.details: Useful when you want to apply both textual and geospatial filters on the dataset.

queries.name: Range Query

inputs_required.column_name: Name of the column to filter on

queries.output_expected: Records where the specified column's value falls within the given range.
queries.explanation: Selects rows whose values in a specified column are within a given range.
queries.details: Typically used for filtering numeric or date ranges.
